bankroll.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to provide the money that someone needs for a business, a plan etc
bankroll.translation[0].definitions[0].e: a software company bankrolled by the Samsung Group
bankroll.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to provide the money a person or company needs to operate a business, find new markets, develop new products etc
bankroll.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Several banks pumped money into the business, bankrolling its expansion until it was floated on the stockmarket.
bankroll.translation[3].definitions[0].d: a supply of money for a particular purpose
bankroll.translation[3].definitions[0].e: Credit Lyonnais could be one of his major backers for the project, providing a bankroll of $100 million or more.
bankroll.translation[3].definitions[1].d: a large amount of paper money rolled together
